data.title: The 40+ Best NBA New Orleans Pelicans Centers
data.meta_description: Over 100 sports fans have voted on the 40+ Best NBA New Orleans Pelicans Centers. Current Top 3: Anthony Davis, DeMarcus Cousins, Tyson Chandler
data.text:
Ranked By

796 votes

161 voters

1 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the New Orleans Pelicans

Big fan of New Orleans basketball? Then check out this list of New Orleans Pelicans centers. It includes almost every center from throughout New Orleans Pelicans history, including current centers and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA centers of all time, the best Pelicans Cs include Emeka Okafor, Tyson Chandler, and P. J. Brown.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current New Orleans Pelicans starting Cs and backup Cs are Jonas Valanciunas, Jaxson Hayes, and Willy Hernangomez.

Who are the best centers in New Orleans Pelicans history? Vote below and help decide the greatest big man in NOLA basketball history!

Most divisive: Jamaal Magloire

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 40+ Best NBA New Orleans Pelicans Centers

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Power forward, Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2012-2019

A transcendent talent, Anthony Davis quickly established himself as a dominant force after being drafted by the New Orleans Pelicans as the first overall pick. With an unparalleled combination of offensive versatility and defensive prowess, Davis became the face of the franchise and led the team to multiple playoff appearances. Though he never captured a championship with the Pelicans, his numerous accolades include multiple NBA All-Star selections, All-NBA First Team honors, and leading the league in blocks three times.

Birthplace : Mobile, Alabama

Nationality : American

Team : Los Angeles Clippers

Position : Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2017-2018

Acquired via a blockbuster trade, DeMarcus Cousins joined the Pelicans in their quest for postseason success. Though his tenure with the team was brief, the hard-nosed, physical big man formed an imposing frontcourt duo alongside Anthony Davis, leaving opposing defenses quaking in their boots. During his time in New Orleans, Cousins earned an All-Star nod and showcased his playmaking abilities, making him a formidable offensive threat on the court.

Birthplace : Hanford, California

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Houston Rockets

Position : Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2006–2009

Arriving in New Orleans via trade, Tyson Chandler quickly made his presence felt with his high-energy play and relentless rebounding. Standing tall as one of the team's anchors on defense, Chandler was known for his shot-blocking and ability to protect the rim, significantly contributing to the Pelicans' early success. Although he didn't receive individual accolades with the team, his consistent play and leadership truly set him apart.

Birthplace : Utena, Lithuania

Nationality : Lithuanian

Team : New Orleans Pelicans

Position : Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2021-2022

Jonas Valančiūnas joined the Pelicans through a trade that added a solid center to the roster that could be relied upon to contribute consistently in the paint. As a traditional big man with a soft touch around the rim, Valančiūnas was crucial in providing a scoring presence and rebounding for the team. He demonstrated a constantly improving offensive arsenal, which included developing a reliable outside shot. During his time with the Pelicans, Valančiūnas proved himself to be a crucial component of the lineup and an indispensable part of the team's success.

Birthplace : Houston, Texas, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New Orleans Hornets

Position : Power forward, Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2009–2012, 2017–2018

Drafted by the then-Charlotte Bobcats but eventually finding his way to the Pelicans through a trade, Emeka Okafor made an immediate impact with his strong interior presence. Known for his shot-blocking prowess and defensive instincts, Okafor also showcased his ability to score in the paint, adding another dimension to his game. His time with the Pelicans saw him selected for the All-Rookie Team and become a crucial part of the franchise's building process.

Birthplace : Long Beach, California

Nationality : United States of America, United Kingdom

Team : New Orleans Pelicans, Denver Nuggets, Miami Heat, Cleveland Cavaliers, Memphis Grizzlies

Position : Center

New Orleans Pelicans: 2004-2008

The high-flying, shot-blocking big man known as the "Birdman" soared onto the New Orleans Pelicans roster after being signed as a free agent. Andersen quickly became a fan favorite due to his relentless work ethic and tenacious play on the defensive end. While he never garnered any significant individual accolades, his energy and passion for the game added a much-needed spark to the team's frontcourt.
